item.title: [SEC-2722] CsrfToken invalidated when using PreAuthenticatedProcessingFilter with checkForPrincipalChanges enabled
item.description:
The issue stems CsrfFilter being called before PreAuthenticatedProcessingFilter in the security filter chain. CsrfFilter will detect that a token exists for the (currently valid) session, but the PreAuthenticatedProcessingFilter invalidates the session later in the chain, so a new token won't be generated for the remainder of this request.

This issue is resolved if the PreAuthenticatedProcessingFilter is added before the CsrfFilter in the chain. Then, session invalidation occurs first, so CsrfFilter will correctly generate a new token for this request.

As a side-note, when this situation occurs, the request attribute "_csrf" won't match the session attribute (which was erased), so any view that relies on the request attribute will see an invalid token instead of an empty one. This is because CsrfFilter sets the request attribute immediately and delays adding the session attribute due to SEC-2276
item.summary: CsrfToken invalidated when using PreAuthenticatedProcessingFilter with checkForPrincipalChanges enabled

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Can you please provide a little more context as to what the order of events are? Are you consuming a CsrfToken or are you trying to use one in the subsequent request. At what point is the CsrfToken being accessed? Please walk me through a detailed step by step example of what is happening and what you expect to happen. Thanks!

Sorry for the delayed response. Here's a basic workflow:

New, unauthenticated user requests root page of site, which contains a form with hidden CSRF token.

1) CsrfFilter generates new token for user, which is stored in servlet request attribute and will be written to session on first access.
2) Preauth filter creates an auth token for this user.
3) page is rendered, form is populated with CSRF token

Everything works fine thus far. Now, if the preauthentication changes and setInvalidateSessionOnPrincipalChange is enabled in the preauthentication filter, a new request from this user would be reauthenticated.

So now, this same user attempts to request the same page but with a different preauthentication principal.

1) CsrfFilter already has a token stored for this user, so uses pre-existing one, writing token stored in session into servlet request attribute.
2) Preauth filter detects principal change, invalidates session (which clears csrf token from session)
3) page is rendered, form is populated with stale token prior to re-authentication

Now this user attempts to post on the form on this page.

1) CsrfFilter has no token, generates a new one, compares this to the one sent in the request, and it doesn't match. Throws InvalidCsrfTokenException.
I provided feedback in my earlier comment but forgot to change the status, sorry.
